message:
build(deps-dev): bump vite from 7.2.2 to 7.2.6

Bumps [vite](https://github.com/vitejs/vite/tree/HEAD/packages/vite) from 7.2.2 to 7.2.6.
- [Release notes](https://github.com/vitejs/vite/releases)
- [Changelog](https://github.com/vitejs/vite/blob/main/packages/vite/CHANGELOG.md)
- [Commits](https://github.com/vitejs/vite/commits/v7.2.6/packages/vite)

---
updated-dependencies:
- dependency-name: vite
  dependency-version: 7.2.6
  dependency-type: direct:development
  update-type: version-update:semver-patch
...

Signed-off-by: dependabot[bot] <support@github.com>
fix(deps): update vite to version 7.2.6 and vitest to version 4.0.16
fix(geo): ensure successful GeoIP resolution message is displayed for simple method
fix(cron): add geoIp script execution to 30-minute job for missing geo information
fix(geo): enhance proxy processing output with index and total count

feat(geoip): add robust multi-stage geo resolution with safe MMDB fallback

- Replace type-based geo lookup with prioritized protocol probing
- Add detailed logging for each protocol resolution attempt
- Introduce simple IP-based geo lookup as secondary fallback
- Add local GeoLite2 MMDB lookup as final fallback
- Make MMDB parsing PHP 7.0–safe with explicit isset checks
- Persist only non-empty geo fields when resolving via MMDB
- Handle MMDB exceptions gracefully and log errors
- Refactor WebGL missing checks into a readable flag
- Limit verbose output to cases where geo or WebGL data was updated

fix(geo): robustly fallback to GeoLite2 MMDB in `locate_recursive`

- Only parse JSON if the web fetch returned a value.
- Populate available fields from the GeoPlugin JSON response.
- Always attempt GeoLite2 (MMDB) lookup as a fallback/supplement.
- Only fill missing properties from the MMDB results (do not overwrite existing values).
- Catch and ignore MMDB lookup errors so `locate_recursive` returns gracefully.

This makes geolocation resolution more resilient when the remote service fails or MMDB files are missing/corrupt.

fix(geo): handle missing/unreadable GeoLite2 MMDB files in GeoPlugin2

Ensure MMDB readers are only created when files exist and catch errors
during initialization to avoid throwing on missing/corrupt DB files.
Also return null early from `locate()` when the city reader is not
available so callers (fallbacks) can proceed safely.

feat(geo): accept optional ProxyDB in getGeoIpSimple and persist results

- Add optional `ProxyDB|null $db` parameter to `getGeoIpSimple($ip, $db = null)`.
- Persist geo data to the provided DB via `$db->updateData($ip, $data)` when available.
- Do not persist the `debug` field (removed before update) to avoid schema mismatch.
- Catch and swallow DB errors to preserve previous behavior when DB is unavailable.

fix(geoIp): split `$item->type` on commas or hyphens and trim/filter parts

Replace `explode('-', $item->type)` with `preg_split('/\s*[,\\-]\s*/', $item->type)` and normalize using `array_map('trim')` + `array_filter()` to handle comma- or hyphen-separated values and remove empty tokens. Remove the `$httpFetch` fallback that forced an extra `'http'` resolution.

feat(proxy): add optional proxy auth to curlGetWithProxy and GeoIpHelper

- Add optional `$username` and `$password` parameters to `curlGetWithProxy`
  and update its docblock. Forward credentials to `buildCurl`.
- Update `GeoIpHelper::resolveGeoProxy` signature to accept optional
  `$username` and `$password` and pass them through to `curlGetWithProxy`.
- Keep parameters optional to remain backward compatible.

This enables authenticated proxy usage while preserving existing calls.
feat(crontab): add geoIp script execution to hourly job for proxy geo information

feat(geoip): fetch up to 100 proxies from DB (prefer active) and include credentials

- Use `refreshDbConnections()` / `ProxyDB->db->select()` to fetch proxies with missing geo info.
- Prefer `status = 'active'` rows first, then fill up to 100 with non-active entries.
- Build input entries as `IP:PORT@USER:PASS` when `username`/`password` exist.
- Replace previous CLI/file input flow with DB-driven batching.
- Minor cleanup: interpolate lock file path and remove unused require.

feat(proxyCollector): include project-root `dead.txt` and `proxies.txt` in discovery

Search `assets/proxies` for `added-*.txt` as before, and also include root-level
files `dead.txt` and `proxies.txt` when present. Deduplicate results and return
a deterministically sorted list of file paths (strings).

fix(check-old-proxy): save working protocols and log re-test results

- Replace var_dump with structured logging of re-test results.
- When reTestProxy finds any working protocol, store `status`, `last_check`, and `type` (joined protocols) via `updateData` instead of marking as untested.
- Keep existing behavior for dead proxies (mark as `dead`).
fix(check-old-proxy): set HTTPS status
fix(crontab): update logging for hourly job execution
fix(crontab): remove redundant check-proxy-type log command from hourly job

refactor: move psutil to minimal requirements

Shift psutil from platform-specific and general installation scripts to requirements-minimal.txt to ensure it is available across all environments.
fix: replace execSync with spawnSync for git add command
refactor: remove unused git merge driver logic from createFileHashesMain
fix(post-merge): remove creation of empty yarn.lock file
fix(backup-db): comment out pip install command for minimal requirements
feat: add executables module for PHP and Python detection
feat: allow __init__.py files
feat(deploy-vps): add checks for sitemap existence before upload

fix(vite-plugin): normalize error messages and guard req.url

- Use `error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)` when serializing errors to avoid accessing undefined `.message`.
- Normalize catch logging in `copyIndexForProduction` to print a safe string.
- Guard `req.url` (check for truthiness) before calling `startsWith` to prevent runtime exceptions.

refactor(bin/deploy-vps): improve SFTP/SSH utilities, add JSDoc, and harden error handling

- Add comprehensive JSDoc for SFTP/SSH helpers (`createSftp`, `useSftp`, `withSSH`, `uploadFile`, `uploadDir`, `writeRemoteFile`, `deleteRemotePath`, `execWithBashrc`, `gitPull`, `shell_exec`)
- Change `useSftp` signature to `useSftp(fn, config?)` so required callback comes first; update all call sites
- Ensure `sftp.end()` is awaited safely in `finally` and failures are swallowed to avoid leaking connections
- Normalize error logging (use `err instanceof Error ? err.message : String(err)`) to avoid undefined `.message`
- Add more precise return/type annotations and stream data typing for `execWithBashrc`
- Propagate optional `config` through `useSftp` calls and improve small runtime checks

fix(vite-gh-pages): guard against undefined viteConfig.build and use fallback

- Add `buildOutDir` fallback: `viteConfig?.build?.outDir || path.join(__dirname, 'dist/react')`.
- Replace direct `viteConfig.build.outDir` usages with `buildOutDir` (clean, .no_jekyll, index.html, copy/publish assets, cache-bust, copyIndexToRoutes).
- Add `// @ts-expect-error` comments before Cheerio instance reassignment to silence TypeScript and allow GC hint.
feat(vite): enable output directory cleanup before each build

feat(auth): normalize authenticated_email and derive admin list from env

- store `authenticated_email` as lowercase for consistent checks
- merge `ADMIN_EMAILS` (comma-separated) and `DJANGO_SUPERUSER_EMAIL` into a single admin list
- validate, trim, deduplicate and lowercase admin emails before matching
- set/unset `$_SESSION['admin']` based on the merged admin list
- include `admin` flag and admin-specific message in `respond_json` result

feat(auth): merge ADMIN_EMAILS and DJANGO_SUPERUSER_EMAIL for admin checks

- Merge `ADMIN_EMAILS` (comma-separated) and `DJANGO_SUPERUSER_EMAIL` into a single admin list during login verification.
- Trim, lowercase, deduplicate and keep only valid email addresses (`FILTER_VALIDATE_EMAIL`) before checking membership.
- Use the merged list to set/unset `$_SESSION['admin']` when a user authenticates.
- Minor tidy: clarify rehash comment placement when upgrading raw passwords to hashed form.

Notes:
- Add `ADMIN_EMAILS` to your environment (comma-separated) if you want multiple admin accounts, e.g.:
  ADMIN_EMAILS=admin1@example.com,admin2@example.com

feat(php_backend): include short 8-char MD5 checksum in proxy filenames

Include a short 8-character MD5 hash of the proxy when creating proxy files for background processing.
This produces concise, deterministic filenames and helps avoid collisions when multiple users/scripts add proxies.

Filename format: added-<script>-<hashFilename>-<8char_checksum>.txt

feat(settings): responsive two-column layout, duotone icons, accessibility

- convert Settings page to responsive two-column layout (top-aligned on mobile)
- move action buttons (Buy saldo, Register Security Key) to the right column
- replace password show/hide span with accessible button and Font Awesome duotone eye icon
- add Font Awesome duotone wallet icon to Buy button and duotone key icon to Register button
- simplify loading/authenticated early returns and clean up markup/formatting

No breaking changes.

feat(login): simplify auth flows, improve UI and accessibility

- convert component signature to `React.FC` and remove `useTranslation` usage
- simplify Google OAuth fetch (no DOM toggles), fix `useEffect` deps
- streamline login/webAuthn error handling and promise catches
- restore Facebook login integration with lightweight handlers
- change layout to responsive two-column form (dark-mode Tailwind classes)
- move primary Login button under inputs; keep social/security buttons in right column
- top-align form on small screens to reduce empty space
- replace show/hide text with Font Awesome duotone eye icon; add duotone key icon for Security Key
- remove debug console logs and redundant code paths

BREAKING CHANGE: removed `t()` translation calls from this component — update callers or reintroduce i18n if translations are required.

feat(webauthn): add WebAuthn registration & authentication (server + client)

- add WEBAUTHN_RP_ID and explanatory comments to .env.example
- add PHP WebAuthn backend endpoints:
  - php_backend/webauthn/register_options.php
  - php_backend/webauthn/register_verify.php
  - php_backend/webauthn/auth_options.php
  - php_backend/webauthn/auth_verify.php
  These endpoints issue/verify challenges, store credentials under tmp/webauthn, and return standardized JSON `{ error: bool, message: string, ... }`.
- update frontend flows:
  - src/react/pages/Settings.tsx — add security-key registration using `@simplewebauthn/browser`
  - src/react/pages/Login.tsx — add login with security-key UI and verify flow
- add i18n keys for registration messages:
  - src/react/locales/en.json
  - src/react/locales/id.json
- add dependencies:
  - composer.json: add `web-auth/webauthn-lib` (PHP server-side library available)
  - package.json: add `@simplewebauthn/browser` (browser helper)
  - bump yarn `packageManager` to `yarn@4.12.0`
- ensure responses use `respond_json` format (error/message) for consistent client handling

Notes:
- Current server-side checks are minimal (challenge matching + credential-id check). For production, enable full cryptographic signature verification using the added `web-auth/webauthn-lib` and consider storing credentials in the DB rather than JSON files.

fix(session): make session folder creation and permissions resilient on Windows

- use suppressed mkdir with correct octal mode (0755)
- normalize path separators before creating/checking folder
- fall back to sys_get_temp_dir()/php_proxy_hunter_sessions if target folder is missing or not writable
- attempt permissive chmod but don't throw on failure (avoid Windows ACL issues)
- remove unused Exception import
chore: update yarn version to 4.12.0 in .yarnrc.yml
feat(python-minimal): add installation of requirements-base.txt in setup scripts
fix(sync-backups): add comparison by size during backup sync

feat(artisan): add proxyCollector2 and schedule it in .crontab.sh

- Add `artisan/proxyCollector2.py`: a lightweight proxy-collector script that
  - reuses `LOCKS_DIR` and `FileLockHelper` for per-file locking and safe concurrent runs
  - filters discovered `added-*.txt` files to those < 800 KB and selects the smallest file
  - extracts proxies, updates DB, and deletes the processed file on success
  - registers signal handlers and ensures locks are released on interrupt/terminate
- Register `artisan/proxyCollector2.py` in `.crontab.sh` (30-minute job), logging to `tmp/logs/crontab/proxy-collector2.log`

This adds a resilient, small-file-first collector and schedules it for periodic execution.

refactor(artisan/proxyCollector): expose LOCKS_DIR and remove explicit lock-dir creation

- Add `LOCKS_DIR = get_relative_path("tmp/locks")` for reusable lock directory path.
- Remove explicit `os.makedirs(...locks_dir...)` — rely on `FileLockHelper` to create the directory.
- Update per-file lock paths to use `LOCKS_DIR`.
- Remove unused `Proxy` import from `proxy_hunter`.

This centralizes lock-dir configuration and avoids redundant directory creation.

feat(artisan): add merge_proxies utility and integrate into proxyCollector

Add `artisan/merge_proxies.py` to consolidate small `added-*.txt` proxy files
(<= 10KB) into a single timestamped merged file (`added-merged-YYYYMMDD-HHMMSS.txt`)
and archive the original source files into `assets/proxies/merged-backup/`
(with timestamped names) to avoid reprocessing duplicates.

Integrate the new utility into `artisan/proxyCollector.py`:
- add `--no-merge` CLI flag to opt out of pre-processing merge step
- import and call `artisan.merge_proxies.main()` before collecting proxies,
  skipping the merge if the module is not importable

This reduces file clutter, deduplicates proxy lines, and prevents repeated
processing of many tiny `added-*.txt` files.

feat(proxyCollector): add --max-instances guard using venv-aware counter

Add `--max-instances` CLI option (default 3) and use a venv-aware process
counter to avoid false positives from system Python launchers. Import
`count_running_files` and call `count_running_files(os.path.abspath(__file__), venv_only=True)`
to early-exit when too many collector instances are detected.

feat(process): add count_running_files helper

Add `src/utils/process/count_running_files.py` — a psutil-based helper that
counts running instances of a target script (default `proxyCollector.py`).
Supports `verbose` and `venv_only` modes to avoid false positives from
system/python launchers by restricting matches to the project virtualenv.
Includes a simple `__main__` demo invocation.

fix(py): normalize OS detection and add MSYS/Windows support

Normalize uname-based OS detection into a platform abstraction and extend support to MSYS environments. This refactors the script to use a single platform switch (linux, macos, windows), updates venv activation checks for Windows, adds shellcheck annotations, and improves readability with clearer sectioning. Also keeps optional Linux permissions handling scoped correctly to the normalized platform.
feat: add bash and batch scripts to run proxyCollector from project root

feat(proxyCollector): add --shuffle flag and update crontab to use it

Add a `--shuffle` CLI option to `artisan/proxyCollector.py` that randomizes
the order of discovered `added-*.txt` files (`random.shuffle`) before
processing to reduce contention across concurrent/crontab runs. Print a
message when shuffling is enabled.

Also update `.crontab.sh` to pass `--shuffle` when invoking the proxy
collector (`--batch-size=50 --shuffle`) so scheduled runs process files
in a randomized order.

refactor(proxyCollector): rename CLI flag --random to --single

Replace the `--random` option and `args.random` usage with `--single`
and `args.single` to make the intent clearer when picking a single random
file for processing.

BREAKING CHANGE: the command-line flag has been renamed. Update any
scripts or automation that used `--random` to use `--single` instead.

refactor(proxyCollector): replace global lock with per-file locks in tmp/locks

Remove the single global lock and switch to per-file locking using lock files
stored in tmp/locks/<basename>.lock. Ensure the locks directory exists, attempt
to acquire a per-file lock before processing each `added-*.txt`, skip files
locked by another process, and release the per-file lock in a finally block.
Preserve signal cleanup by storing the current per-file lock in
`_global_file_lock` while a file is being processed.

- Use `Path.rglob` for recursive discovery of `added-*.txt`.
- Create `tmp/locks` if missing and name locks by source filename.
- Skip locked files instead of blocking the whole process.
- Keep per-file locks local to each file and release them immediately after use.
refactor(proxyCollector): simplify get_added_proxy_files function to use pathlib for recursive file search

refactor(php_backend): store web-submitted proxy files in assets/proxies

Replaced temporary `tmp()/proxies/*.txt` usage with persistent `assets/proxies/added-<script>-<hash>.txt`
files for background runner processing.

Rationale:
Centralize proxy input files under `assets/proxies` and standardize filename pattern (`added-<script>-<hash>.txt`)
so background runners have consistent, persistent paths to read and process.
feat(cfh): implement git merge driver functionality for hash generation
fix(gitattributes): enhance large file support with additional file types for Git LFS
fix(post-commit): improve Git LFS detection and warning message

chore(hooks): configure merge.resolve_hash in post-commit hook

Add commands to `.husky/post-commit` to set `merge.resolve_hash.name` and
`merge.resolve_hash.driver` in the local git config after commits. This helps
ensure the custom merge driver (`node bin/cfh.cjs`) is available locally so
future merges of `.husky/hash.txt` use the configured resolver.

chore(git): document merge-driver setup and add setup-merge-driver task

Add a note to `.gitattributes` describing the `merge.resolve_hash.name` setting
and shell-specific driver command examples. Add `setup-merge-driver` task to
`Taskfile.yml` to configure `merge.resolve_hash` locally and verify file
attributes, making it easier for collaborators to enable the custom merge
driver for `.husky/hash.txt`.

docs(gitattributes): clarify merge-driver setup and verification

Add platform-specific examples for configuring the `merge.resolve_hash` driver
(bash, PowerShell, cmd.exe) and include verification commands to check the
local git merge config and file attributes. This makes it easier for
collaborators to configure the custom merge driver correctly across shells.
fix(gitattributes): clarify instructions for setting up merge driver
fix(post-merge): improve CWD detection and error handling for Git repository root
Use resolve_hash merge driver for .husky/hash.txt
fix(checker-runner): accept valid JSON response even if origin is empty

fix(checker-runner): validate JSON `origin` in `reTestProxy`

Decode the response from httpbin.org/ip and ensure it's valid JSON.
Require a non-empty `origin` field before marking a proxy as working.
This prevents false positives when the response is non-JSON or missing `origin`.
fix(check-https-proxy): add 'https' field to last check data

feat(proxy-submission): add "Check Untested" button and handler

Fetch untested proxies from `/php_backend/proxy-list.php` (via `createUrl`) with a capped `length=1000`,
build a newline-separated proxy list and reuse `runSingleCheck` by wrapping `checkProxyHttps`.
Show appropriate snackbars for no-results and error cases.

Prevents the frontend from requesting "show all" while reusing existing check logic.

fix(proxy-list): disallow show-all (-1) and cap per-page results

Treat `length = -1` as a request for many rows and cap it to `$MAX_PER_PAGE` (1000).
Clamp `length` to the range `[1, $MAX_PER_PAGE]` to prevent excessive memory/CPU usage.
Prevents expensive "show all" queries from overloading small VPS instances.
fix(proxy-extractor): send extracted proxies to backend on submit
fix(crontab): redirect log output to file correctly
fix(check-old-proxy): skip re-checking items with transient/open statuses
fix(check-old-proxy): comment out skipped log message for recently checked proxies

chore(bin): rename py-update to py-dev and use repo-local Python launcher

Rename `bin/py-update`/`bin/py-update.cmd` to `bin/py-dev`/`bin/py-dev.cmd`.
Standardize both scripts to invoke the repository-local Python launcher from
the script directory (`$SCRIPT_DIR/py` / `%~dp0py.cmd`), install the project's
`requirements-dev.txt` from the repo root, and run `setup.py develop` for the
three local packages.

- Renamed: bin/py-update -> bin/py-dev (POSIX)
- Renamed: bin/py-update.cmd -> bin/py-dev.cmd (Windows)
- Scripts now: install `requirements-dev.txt` from project root and run package dev installs
fix(vps-mgr): update command to use py.cmd for executing vps_manager.py

feat(time): decouple core time util from Django and update templatetag

- Remove Django-specific imports/logic from `src/utils/date/timeAgo.py`
  and make the utility framework-agnostic.
- Add optional `tz` parameter to `time_ago(...)` to control localization
  for naive datetimes (accepts tz name or tzinfo-like objects).
- Update `django_backend/apps/core/templatetags/time_filters.py` to:
  - parse string inputs,
  - localize naive datetimes using Django's timezone (fallback to settings.TIME_ZONE),
  - pass an aware `datetime` into the core `time_ago` utility.
- Adjust typing to accept both `str` and `datetime` inputs and to handle
  tz-aware datetimes correctly.

BREAKING CHANGE: `time_ago` signature changed to `time_ago(value, tz=None)`.
Callers relying on the old signature or Django-only behavior should be updated.
fix(requirements): remove asyncio from base requirements

fix(hooks): prefer project venv python & invoke Black via python -m

Prepend the project's virtualenv `venv/Scripts` or `venv/bin` to `PATH` in `.husky/pre-commit`
so hooks use the project Python interpreter. Update `.lintstagedrc.json` to run
`python -m black` for `*.py` files instead of calling `black` directly. This prevents
pre-commit failures when Black is installed only in the project's venv (Windows/venv cases).

refactor(scrappers): make scrapers synchronous and use ThreadPoolExecutor

- Convert scraper base and handler methods from async to sync (scrapper_base.py).
- Replace asyncio orchestration with ThreadPoolExecutor and httpx.Client (scrapper.py).
- Update HTML and GitHub scrapers to synchronous `handle()` and add defensive null checks in html_parser.py.
- Update tests to call the synchronous `scrape()` directly and remove asyncio usage.
- Remove `asyncio` from package metadata (pyproject.toml, setup.py).

BREAKING CHANGE: `scrape()` is now synchronous (was an `async def`). Consumers must call it directly instead of awaiting or running it in an event loop.

fix(proxy-hunter-python): keep proxies as list and use asyncio.run in test

- Keep `proxies` as a list during scraping and create `proxies_set` for deduplication before writing to file in `packages/proxy-hunter-python/proxy_hunter/scrappers/scrapper.py` to avoid Pylance warning about `extend` on a set.
- Replace deprecated `asyncio.get_event_loop()` with `asyncio.run()` and add a `new_event_loop()` fallback in `packages/proxy-hunter-python/tests/scrapper_test.py` (renamed from `packages/proxy-hunter-python/proxy_hunter/scrappers/direct.test.py`).
- Remove unused `platform` and `sys` imports from the test file.
fix(sftp_sync): update default comparison mode to 'size' and enhance parameter documentation

chore(index.dev.html): switch Font Awesome to official site-assets v7 CSS

- Comment out previous rawcdn.githack.com `all.min.css` link.
- Add official Font Awesome v7 site-assets CSS links:
  - all.css
  - sharp-solid.css
  - sharp-regular.css
  - sharp-light.css
  - duotone.css

Reason: use official CDN assets and include specific style packs.

feat(node_browser): add web asset capture and mirror scripts

Add two new utilities to `node_browser/`:

- `crawl.js` — Puppeteer-based asset capturer that:
  - captures network requests/responses (images, fonts, CSS, JS, XHR, etc.)
  - DOM-sweeps for static links (img, script, link, source, video, audio, iframe, a)
  - writes discovered URLs to `assets.txt` and embedded font sources to `embedded-fonts.txt`

- `httrack.js` — lightweight HTTrack-like downloader using `undici` + `cheerio` that:
  - mirrors pages and assets, rewrites links for local browsing
  - parses CSS `url(...)` references to enqueue/download fonts and images
  - appends saved URLs to `downloaded_urls.txt`
  - defaults to `https://fontawesome.com/icons/filter?f=duotone&s=du` (env override via `HTTRACK_START`)
  - defaults output folder to `tmp/mirror` and supports CLI flags `-o`, `-c`, and `--same-origin`

Includes basic deduping (visited set) and concurrency control. Dependencies: `puppeteer`, `undici`, `cheerio`.

feat(proxy-list): add two-column tabs for ProxySubmission and ProxyExtractor; use duotone icons

- Add `subTab` React state and replace stacked `ProxySubmission` / `ProxyExtractor` render with a full-width 2-column tab header (50% / 50%) and tab panels.
- Implement tablist markup (ul/li) with aria attributes (`role="tablist"`, `role="tab"`, `aria-controls`, `aria-current`) and panel ids to improve accessibility.
- Panels are kept mounted and visibility toggled via `hidden` class (Flowbite-like behavior).
- Update styling for active/inactive states and dark mode (text/border hover + `dark:` classes).
- Unify icons to Font Awesome duotone:
  - Tab headers: magnifying glass for "Proxy checker" and duotone/solid filter for "Proxy extractor".
  - Component headers: `ProxySubmission` and `ProxyExtractor` now use matching duotone icons.
  - Replace the "Check Type" button icon with the duotone filter icon.
- Minor whitespace/formatting adjustments around the recaptcha block.

No breaking changes.

feat(proxy-list): add ProxyExtractor component and wire into ProxyList

- Add new component `src/react/pages/ProxyList/ProxyExtractor.tsx`
  - Textarea input with `Populate` sample data and `Extract` action
  - Autosave/restore using `ReactFormSaver` (`storagePrefix="proxy-extractor"`)
  - Uses `src/proxy/extractor.js` (`extractProxiesToObject`) to parse proxies
  - Formats results as unique lines `IP:PORT@USER:PASS` (deduplicated, preserves order)
  - Displays read-only results textarea and a count badge when > 0
  - Replaced button icon with `fa-magnifying-glass` and removed the Clear button
  - Minor JSX/lint formatting fixes

- Wire `ProxyExtractor` into `src/react/pages/ProxyList/index.tsx`

No breaking changes.

fix(proxy-extractor): normalize matches, extract JSON creds, support auth formats, add tests

- Normalize whitespace and JSON regex matches into canonical `ip:port` entries.
- Extract JSON `"user"` / `"pass"` fields and attach credentials to parsed proxies.
- Support both `ip:port@user:pass` and `user:pass@ip:port` formats.
- Deduplicate results, preferring entries that include credentials.
- Add Jest tests (`tests/proxy/extractProxies.test.js`) covering plain, auth-suffix, auth-prefix, and JSON formats.

fix(php-extractor): normalize matches, extract JSON user/pass, prioritize credentials

- Normalize whitespace and JSON regex matches into canonical `proxy` entries (ip:port).
- Capture JSON `"user"` / `"pass"` fields and attach credentials to parsed `Proxy` objects.
- Merge normalized matches and deduplicate results, prioritizing entries that include credentials.
- Relax JSON ip/port regex spacing and normalize match output to a unified shape.
- Minor test/comment whitespace cleanups.

fix(proxy-hunter-python): extract JSON user/pass for ip:port entries and add tests

- When parsing JSON-formatted `{"ip":"x.x.x.x","port":"yyyy"}` entries, detect
  surrounding `"user"`/`"pass"` fields and attach credentials to the resulting
  `Proxy` object.
- Add `test_extract_proxies_json_ip_port_auth` and adjust/rename JSON-related
  tests to cover ip/port, proxy field, and JSON auth cases.

Files changed:
- packages/proxy-hunter-python/proxy_hunter/extractor.py: extract JSON `user`/`pass`
  and create `Proxy(proxy, username, password)` when present.
- packages/proxy-hunter-python/tests/proxy_extractor.py: add/rename tests for JSON
  ip/port and JSON ip+auth scenarios.

fix(proxy-hunter-python): normalize regex matches and handle auth formats; add tests

- Normalize whitespace and JSON regex matches to canonical "ip:port" strings so
  JSON and whitespace-formatted proxies are detected reliably.
- Relax and clarify JSON IP/port regex (allow optional spaces) and convert regex

feat(vps/sftp_client): add remote glob support to download

Add shell-style glob expansion for remote paths in `download()` so callers
can use patterns like `*.log`, `file-?.txt`, or `[a-z]*.csv` to fetch
multiple remote files or directories.

- Added helper `_remote_glob(pattern: str) -> list` to expand glob patterns
  by listing remote directories and matching components with `fnmatch`.
- Imported `fnmatch` and `posixpath`.
- `download()` now detects glob characters and:
  - Expands the pattern and downloads each match.
  - Preserves single-match semantics (allows `local_path` as a target filename).
  - For multiple matches, ensures `local_path` exists and places matches inside it.
  - Recursively downloads directory matches using existing logic.
- Emits a friendly warning when no remote matches are found.
- Does not implement recursive `**` globs (only per-component `*`, `?`, `[...]`).

Examples:
- `download("/var/logs/*.log", "local_logs/")` — download all log files into `local_logs/`
- `download("/home/user/data/report-2025-*.csv", "reports/")` — download matching CSVs

Notes:

- No additional tests added in this commit.

feat(db): add deterministic table checksum API and implement for MySQL/SQLite

- Add abstract `calculateChecksum($table, array $columns = null)` to `src/PhpProxyHunter/BaseSQL.php`.
- Delegate checksum calls from `CoreDB::calculateChecksum()` to the underlying helper.
- Fix `CoreDB::select()` defaults to use `null` for `where/orderBy/limit/offset` (prevents accidental `LIMIT 0`).
- MySQLHelper:
  - Accept `$columns` as an array (safely quote identifiers).
  - Normalize named params (strip leading `:`) before execute.
  - Implement `calculateChecksum()`:
    - Try `CHECKSUM TABLE` first; fallback to per-row SHA2 hashing + GROUP_CONCAT then SHA2.
- SQLiteHelper:
  - Accept `$columns` as an array (safely quote identifiers).
  - Normalize named params (strip leading `:`) before execute.
  - Implement `calculateChecksum()`:
    - Select rows deterministically and compute SHA-256 of pipe-separated row values.
- Tests:
  - Update `tests/PhpProxyHunter/CoreDBTest.php` to use upsert semantics:
    - MySQL: `ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE value = VALUES(value)`
    - SQLite: `INSERT OR REPLACE`
- Minor: small PDO/formatting tweak in SQLite helper (reposition comment).

BREAKING CHANGE: Adding the abstract `calculateChecksum` to `BaseSQL` requires all custom DB helper implementations to implement `calculateChecksum`. The repository's included `MySQLHelper` and `SQLiteHelper` now implement it, but third-party or legacy drivers must be updated.

refactor(utils): move and harden mergeHeaders into buildCurl

Moved the `mergeHeaders` implementation from `func-proxy.php` into
`src/PhpProxyHunter/utils/buildCurl.php` and replaced the previous
fragile explode-based logic with a more robust implementation.

- New behavior:
  - Accepts headers in "Key: Value" or "Key:Value" forms.
  - Trims keys and values.
  - Case-insensitive header-name deduplication (last occurrence wins).
  - Removes `Accept-Encoding` by default (preserves previous behavior).
  - Returns an array of "Key: Value" strings compatible with CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER.

- Changes made:
  - `buildCurl()` now calls `mergeHeaders($default_headers, $headers)` and
    no longer performs in-function header dedupe.
  - Removed the old `mergeHeaders` from `func-proxy.php` to avoid duplication.

Notes:
- If other code relied on `mergeHeaders` being defined by including
  `func-proxy.php`, ensure `src/PhpProxyHunter/utils/buildCurl.php` is included
  where needed (or move the helper to a shared utilities file) to avoid
  undefined-function errors.
- To preserve `Accept-Encoding`, call `mergeHeaders($defaults, $additional, false)`.

- Replace incorrect `array_map('processCheckProxy', $chs)` with an explicit
  loop so each multi-SSL result includes an `ssl_variant` index.
- Consolidate `curl_getinfo()` usage and capture `curl_info` before closing the
  handle; stop returning a closed cURL handle.
- Make request-header retrieval robust: avoid direct constant references by
  resolving `CURLOPT_HEADER_OUT`/`CURLINFO_HEADER_OUT` dynamically and provide
  fallbacks to keys from `curl_getinfo()` when constants are unavailable.
- Keep all existing error/anonymity logic intact; changes are additive and aim
  to improve observability and multi-SSL correctness.

fix(bin): make `bin/kills` robust and cross-platform

- Rewrote `bin/kills` to detect Windows-like (CYGWIN/MINGW/MSYS) vs Unix-like
  environments and handle each appropriately.
- On Windows: use `taskkill /F /IM <proc>` with a `wmic` fallback for termination.
- On Unix: prefer `pgrep -f` and fall back to `ps | awk` to collect PIDs, and only
  call `kill -9` when PIDs are present (avoids invoking `kill` with no args).
- Added helper functions (`kill_by_name_unix`, `kill_by_name_windows`), logging,
  and safer error handling (`set -u`, ignore missing tools).
- Removes fragile `ps | grep | xargs kill` usage that produced `kill` help output.

Prevents accidental `kill` usage/help spam and makes process cleanup reliable
across environments.

fix(MySQLHelper): add automatic connection loss detection and recovery

Add resilient connection handling to prevent MySQL timeout errors (error 4031)
during long-running operations. Implements automatic reconnection with retry logic
for database operations.

BREAKING CHANGE: None. Changes are backward compatible.

- Store connection parameters for automatic reconnection
- Add isConnectionAlive() to validate active connections
- Add isConnectionLossError() to detect connection loss errors (4031, 2006, 2013, HY000, 08006, 08003)
- Add reconnect() for automatic reconnection to MySQL
- Add withConnectionRetry() wrapper for transparent operation retry
- Wrap select(), update(), execute(), insert() with retry logic
- Handle all major MySQL connection timeout scenarios

Fixes: SQLSTATE[HY000] error 4031 - "Client disconnected by server due to inactivity"

Affected operations:
- select(): Critical for proxy lookups
- update(): Essential for saving proxy check results
- execute(): Custom SQL queries
- insert(): Adding new proxies

Performance impact: Zero overhead in normal operations, 50-200ms recovery on connection loss.

protocol, and normalizes retest outcomes.

operators can see whether a secondary probe ran and what it returned.

fix(executables): avoid caret escapes on Windows by quoting executables

When escaping executable paths for shell use, `escapeshellcmd` on Windows can
insert caret (`^`) characters which corrupt paths like
`C:\xampp\php\php.exe` (becoming `C:^\xampp^\php^\php.exe`). Change the
behavior of `getPhpExecutable` and `getPythonExecutable` to return a safely
double-quoted path on Windows when escaping is requested, and fall back to
`escapeshellcmd` on non-Windows platforms.

This preserves correct quoting for `cmd.exe` while keeping existing escaping

fix(geo-plugin): write MMDB downloads to temp file and move atomically

Write downloaded GeoLite2 MMDB files to a temporary file first (using
sys_get_temp_dir()/tempnam) and then move to the final destination to
avoid partial/corrupt files. Use atomic rename() with a copy+unlink
fallback across filesystems, ensure destination directory exists, and
improve error logging. This prevents concurrent/partial-write issues.

feat(server/respond): accept optional HTTP status in response helpers

feat(php-cs-fixer): add dynamic custom fixer loading and introduce no-multiple-statements-per-line fallback

refactor(cs-fixer): rename GlobalOneLineFixer namespace to PhpCsFixerCustom

feat(cs-fixer): add GlobalOneLineFixer and enable rule

multi-line `global` statements into a single-line form.

- Add `src/dev/php-cs-fixer/GlobalOneLineFixer.php` implementing token-based
  conversion.
- Require and register the fixer in `.php-cs-fixer.dist.php`.
- Refactor config to build `$rules` and enable `'Custom/global_one_line' => true`.

fix(geo): prevent concurrent GeoMMDB downloads in GeoPlugin2

feat(scripts): add geoip-installer and update download logic

- add `scripts/geoip-installer.js` to fetch GeoLite2 MMDB files:
  - follows redirects for HEAD/GET, reads Content-Length
  - downloads only when remote size is larger than local (or when local missing)
  - writes to `tmp/download` then copies to `src/`

This adds automatic GeoIP MMDB management and tightens update conditions to avoid unnecessary downloads.

feat(timeago): add `simple` and `unitOnly` options; use compact output in ProxyList

Add optional parameters to `timeAgo(dateString, simple = false, unitOnly = false)`:
- `simple=true` shortens output: when days > 0 show days and hours (hide minutes & seconds); when hours > 0 (and days === 0) hide seconds only.
- Minutes-as-top-unit still include seconds (e.g. "2 minutes 10 seconds"), seconds-only unchanged.
- `unitOnly=true` uses short unit labels (d/h/m/s), e.g. "1d 3h ago".

Update `src/react/pages/ProxyList/index.tsx` to call `timeAgo(proxy.last_check, true, true)` so last-check times render in the compact form.

No breaking changes (defaults remain `false`).

- No behavioral changes to `tmp(...)` (logic preserved).

fix(tmp): append filenames to tmp() result instead of passing them into tmp()

- Avoid passing filename-like args into `tmp()` (it creates directories named like the file).
- Use `tmp()` to obtain the directory and append the filename instead.

Reason: calling `tmp('locks/whatever.lock')` created a folder named `whatever.lock`, breaking lock-file behavior; this change ensures real lock files are used.
fix(FileLockHelper): delete the lock file gracefully upon unlocking
fix(proxy-add): add early exit if the lock is already acquired to prevent concurrent proxy additions

refactor(PhpProxyHunter/FileLockHelper): centralize lock-file handling and unify lock checks

- Add private `openLockHandle()` to ensure lock directory, check writability
  and open the lock file (suppressing fopen warnings).
- Refactor `lock()` to reuse the new helper and properly close handles on failure.
- Replace `isLockedByAnotherProcess()` with a single `isLocked()` implementation
  that attempts an exclusive non-blocking `flock` to detect active locks and
  falls back to `file_exists()` when the file can't be opened.
- Update CLI demo to call `isLocked()` and update unit tests to use the new API.
- Improve error handling around directory creation/opening to avoid noisy PHP warnings.
fix(FileLockHelper): improve directory creation and locking logic to handle errors gracefully

feat(recaptcha): check session expiry before executing recaptcha

  recaptcha session has expired before calling `recaptchaRef.current?.executeAsync()`.
- Prevent unnecessary recaptcha executions by only calling `verifyRecaptcha`
  when the session is expired.

This reduces redundant recaptcha calls and centralizes session-expiry logic.

fix(security): strictly validate captcha and block unauthorized access

- Treat a false captcha session as unresolved in `embed.php` by changing the check
  from `empty($_SESSION['captcha'])` to `empty($_SESSION['captcha']) || !$_SESSION['captcha']`.
- Add an early server-side guard in `php_backend/proxy-working.php` that returns
  a JSON error ("Access denied") when the captcha session is missing or falsy.

This prevents access bypass when `$_SESSION['captcha']` is present but false
and enforces captcha validation for proxy-related endpoints.

Import and use useLocation in MainApp and make the pageview/title effect
depend on location.pathname. Support routes with array paths when resolving
titles, send GA pageviews with the SPA path, and simplify reCAPTCHA
invocation to call verifyRecaptcha directly. Remove the redundant hardcoded
`document.title` in `src/react/pages/Login.tsx`.
fix(recaptcha): make token parameter optional in verifyRecaptcha function

- Verification: run the dev server and visually inspect key pages in dark mode.

feat(server): add unified response helpers for JSON, text, and HTML outputs

Introduced respond.php with utility functions:

Each function ensures correct Content-Type handling and terminates execution after output.

feat(user-payment-logs): add explicit filtering logic for package and payment action types

refactor(file): extract path and mkdir helpers; make ensure_dir variadic and add ensure_dirs

  creates directories recursively and returns the created path or false
- `ensure_dirs` provides bulk creation, accepting strings or arrays of segments and returning an indexed map of results

This reorganizes utility functions for clearer separation of concerns and adds improved path handling and multi-directory creation.

feat(file): make ensure_dir accept variadic path segments and add ensure_dirs helper

- update `ensure_dir` to accept variadic segments (`...$segments`), normalize and join
  path segments, collapse duplicate separators, handle Windows/Unix roots, create the

- add new `ensure_dirs(...$dirs)` helper to create multiple directories in one call.
  Each argument may be a string path or an array of segments; returns an indexed map
  of results (created path or false).

This improves path handling and convenience for creating one or many directories.

fix(proxy-checker): use project tmp, ensure output dir and fix Windows runner

- use `tmp()` for runner/pid paths (avoid `__DIR__/tmp`)
- ensure output directory exists before redirecting (`ensure_dir(dirname($output_file))`)

fix(proxy): limit large proxy result sets to prevent memory exhaustion

Limit the number of rows fetched from the proxies table to avoid loading
very large result sets into PHP memory. Use a conservative sample size:
- `getUntestedProxies(1000)` in `php_backend/proxy-checker.php`
- `getWorkingProxies(5000)` in `func-proxy.php`

This prevents "Allowed memory size exhausted" errors on large databases
while remaining a low-risk, backward-compatible change. Sizes are tunable
if different sampling is desired.

fix(proxy-list): conditionally start background checker based on processes.php output

- Replace unconditional `processes.php` fetch with a text response check.
- Only call `artisan/proxyCheckerStarter.php` when the response indicates "no running".
- Preserve the 5-minute throttle using `lastProxyCheckStart` in localStorage.
- Add error handling via `.catch(noop)` to keep behavior resilient.

This prevents unnecessary starter calls when the background checker is already running.

feat(proxy-list): switch to server-side pagination and return meta from getWorkingProxies

- Add serverTotal and serverTotalPages state to track server-side totals.
- Update fetchAndSetProxies to accept (page, per) and consume `{ data, meta }` from the backend; persist only the data in localStorage.
- Change getWorkingProxies signature to return `{ data: any[], meta: any | null }` and handle page/perPage, meta, and 403/error cases.
- Use server-provided totalPages for pagination (totalPages = serverTotalPages) and display serverTotal in the UI.
- Replace client-side slice pagination with server-driven paging and add an effect to refetch when page or rowsPerPage change.
- Refactor pagination UI into a responsive three-column layout: total (left), page controls (center), rows-per-page (right).

Notes:
- Preserves previous sorting (last_check desc) when randomize is false; prepared to accept backend `meta.total` and `meta.totalPages`.
- Local caching now stores only the `data` array to avoid storing meta alongside results.

feat(proxy): add paginated proxy-working API and client parsing

- Add `php_backend/proxy-working.php` endpoint that returns `{ data, meta }`
  and supports pagination (page, perPage/limit), randomize flag, and safe
  defaults/caps (DEFAULT_PER_PAGE=100, MAX_PER_PAGE=1000).
- Extend `ProxyDB::getWorkingProxies()` to accept `randomize`, `page`, `perPage`
  and to order by `last_check DESC` when `randomize=false`; preserves legacy
  single-argument `$limit` behavior for backward compatibility.
- Update React `ProxyList` to call `/php_backend/proxy-working.php` with
  page/perPage/randomize parameters, parse the `{data,meta}` response, and
  retain existing client-side transformations and caching.

Notes: server enforces per-page caps and safe defaults to prevent large payloads.
feat(proxy-add): change response handling to process text instead of JSON

feat(proxy-add): add robust locking, JSON errors and optional merge to proxies.txt

- return early with 400 + JSON when request body is empty
- acquire `FileLockHelper` earlier and fail fast if lock can't be obtained
- persist per-user `assets/proxies/added-<user>.txt`, append new proxies, then remove empty/duplicate lines
- when `proxyChecker.lock` exists, also append new proxies into `proxies.txt` (merge/backup)
- switch to consistent JSON responses and small code cleanup (shared include, clearer flow)

feat(proxy-add): add file locking, parse and normalize added proxies, return JSON responses

- Add `FileLockHelper` usage and per-user lock file to prevent concurrent writes.
- Return JSON responses and set `Content-Type: application/json` for API consistency.
- Normalize incoming data by extracting valid proxies, converting `Proxy` objects to text
  (using their string representation), appending them to per-user added file, and
  cleaning the file by removing empty and duplicate lines.
- Improve error handling: respond with informative JSON messages when no valid proxies
  are found or when another process holds the lock.
- Minor style/formatting: compact function declaration `function get_ports() {`.

Why:
- Prevent race conditions when multiple requests add proxies simultaneously.
- Ensure stored proxies are normalized and deduplicated.
- Make API behavior clearer for clients with JSON responses.

feat(proxy): add __toString to Proxy and enhance test output

- Add magic __toString() to `src/PhpProxyHunter/Proxy.php` to return a compact
  textual representation in the form `proxy@user:pass`. Omits empty username/
  password parts (returns just `proxy` if username missing, empty string if all
  fields empty).
- Keep `toJson()` unchanged; __toString is safe and returns a string even on
  failure.
- Update `tests/extractProxy.php` to print additional debug/info output:
  - Total extracted proxies count.
  - Example JSON transformation via `toJson(true, true)`.
  - Example text transformation via `(string) $extract[0]`.
- Adjust function formatting in `tests/extractProxy.php` (`function get_ports() {`).

Why:
- Improve developer ergonomics when casting `Proxy` objects to string or
  concatenating them in logs/tests, and provide richer test output for manual
  verification.

Notes:
- Behavior: (string)$proxy now yields one of:
  - "" (if proxy, username, password all empty)
  - "proxy" (if username missing)
  - "proxy@user" (if password missing)
  - "proxy@user:pass" (if both present)
- No breaking changes to existing serialization (`toJson()`).

fix(sqlitehelper): use per-operation cursors and normalize execute params

- Remove shared `self.cursor`; create and close a local cursor for each DB
  operation (create_table, insert, select, count, update, delete,
  execute_query, truncate_table, dump_database_truncate).
- Normalize parameters passed to `cursor.execute()` (convert lists to tuples)
  to avoid sqlite3.InterfaceError / "bad parameter or other API misuse".
- Add debug logging in `select` to print SQL and parameter shapes when an
  InterfaceError occurs (helps diagnose bad param usage from callers).
- Fix `dump_database_truncate` nesting/indentation and ensure cursor is
  closed in a finally block.
- Avoid creating/closing a cursor in `close()`; close the connection directly.

No functional change to SQL semantics; this hardens SQLiteHelper for
multithreaded use and prevents recursive cursor reuse errors.

are removed when the request completes. Log and preserve false on network/error
failures to avoid repeated retries.

fix(artisan/filterPortsDuplicate): use DB-compatible month check instead of SQLite strftime

Replace SQLite-only strftime(...) call in wasCheckedThisMonth() with a driver-aware SQL check.
- Use DATE_FORMAT(...) = DATE_FORMAT(NOW(), ...) for MySQL.
- Fallback to comparing the YYYY-MM prefix via LIKE for other drivers (e.g. SQLite).
- Bind :monthPrefix for the fallback and avoid using SQLite-only functions in SQL.

This prevents PDOException on MySQL (FUNCTION ... strftime does not exist) and preserves behavior across DB engines.

feat(artisan): add CLI proxyChecker to test HTTP/SOCKS proxies and update DB

Add new CLI script `artisan/proxyChecker.php` that accepts `--proxy "IP:PORT"` or
`"IP:PORT@user:pass"` and performs protocol checks for `http`, `socks4`,
`socks5`, `socks4a`, and `socks5h`. For each protocol the checker tries an HTTPS
endpoint first and falls back to an HTTP endpoint. Results for all tested
protocols are aggregated and persisted to the project `ProxyDB`:

- Adds `artisan/proxyChecker.php`.
- CLI-only; exits if not run from CLI.
- Parses optional proxy credentials in `IP:PORT@user:pass` form.
- Tests protocols: `http`, `socks4`, `socks5`, `socks4a`, `socks5h`.
- Tries endpoints per protocol: HTTPS first (https://www.example.com), then
  HTTP fallback (http://httpforever.com/).
- Aggregates working protocols into `type` (e.g. `socks4-socks5`), sets
  `status = active`, stores best `latency` (min), `private` flag, and `https`
  support. Records `anonymity` (when available) and invokes geoip lookup
  best-effort.
- Marks proxy as `port-closed` when port is unreachable or `dead` otherwise.
- Reuses existing helpers from `php_backend/shared.php` and `func-proxy.php`
  (`checkProxy`, `get_anonymity`, `GeoIpHelper`, `ProxyDB`).
- Non-breaking addition; improves proxy validation coverage for multiple
  proxy types and both SSL/non-SSL endpoints.

No breaking changes; purely additive CLI tooling.

and document it in the function docblock. When enabled the function skips calls to
`isValidProxy()` and `isValidIp()` for user:pass, whitespace and JSON matches,
allowing invalid-looking proxies to be returned. Backward-compatible (default
behavior unchanged).

feat(db): mark proxy as added only when insert succeeds; remove $force param

- Remove unused $force parameter from `ProxyDB::add()` signature.
- Trim proxy, call `$this->db->insert(...)` and check its boolean result.
- Only call `markAsAdded()` when the insert returns true (avoid marking failed inserts).
- Keeps behaviour clearer and prevents recording proxies that weren't actually persisted.

BREAKING CHANGE: `ProxyDB::add($proxy, $force = false)` -> `ProxyDB::add($proxy)`; callers must be updated if they relied on the old signature.

refactor(db): make insert() return bool and handle failures gracefully

- Update abstract signature in src/PhpProxyHunter/BaseSQL.php:
  - change insert(...) to return bool and update docblock.

- Update src/PhpProxyHunter/MySQLHelper.php:
  - add return type bool, validate empty $data and return false.
  - return true on successful execute; catch PDOException and return false.
  - update docblock to reflect boolean return.

- Update src/PhpProxyHunter/SQLiteHelper.php:
  - add return type bool, validate empty $data and return false.
  - return true on successful execute; catch PDOException and return false.
  - update docblock to reflect boolean return.

BREAKING CHANGE: The BaseSQL::insert signature now returns bool (true on success, false on failure).
Callers must handle the boolean result and adjust any logic that previously relied on exceptions or a void return.

fix(proxyCollector): improve blacklist removal query compatibility for SQLite and MySQL

- Updated DELETE query to be compatible with both SQLite and MySQL

fix(husky): run composer only when composer.json or PHP files changed

Detect changed files between the previous ref (prefer ORIG_HEAD, fallback to HEAD^) and HEAD,
and only run Composer when `composer.json` or any `.php` files were modified. If the previous
ref can't be determined, conservatively run Composer when `composer.json` exists.

Preserves existing behavior (install vs update, `--no-dev` on VPS, attempt to run as configured user)
and prints a clear message when skipping Composer.

fix(husky): require git-lfs only when repository uses LFS

Detect LFS usage via `.gitattributes` and `git lfs track` and only fail the hook
if the repo uses LFS and `git-lfs` is missing. Otherwise print a note and continue.
Run `git lfs post-commit` only when LFS is in use.

feat(func): make runBashOrBatch output redirection opt-in

stdout/stderr is redirected into `tmp/logs/<identifier>.txt`; when disabled the
script is invoked without redirection. Preserve platform-specific handling
(Windows vs. Unix) and clarify runner/background execution with comments.

BREAKING CHANGE: default behavior changed from redirecting output to NOT
redirecting it. Callers that expect logs must now pass `$redirectOutput = true`.
